title: Pictorial Cues in Depth Perception
description: Identify which depth perception cue is a pictorial cue.
question_text:
Which of the following is a pictorial cue?

1. Occlusion
2. Accommodation
3. Parallax

title: Monocular vs. Binocular Depth Cues
description: Classify the following depth perception cues as either monocular or binocular.
question_text:
Sort the following depth perception cues into their correct categories: monocular or binocular.

Occlusion (overlap)  
Perspective  
Accommodation (focus)  
Motion Parallax  
Convergence  
Fusion (stereopsis)  
Edge Effects

solution.final_answer:
Monocular cues: Occlusion, Perspective, Accommodation, Motion Parallax  
Binocular cues: Convergence, Fusion, Edge Effects
steps: Remember that monocular cues can be perceived with one eye, while binocular cues require both eyes.

title: Depthly Hallows in Depth Perception
description: Identify which depth perception cues are considered part of the 'Depthly Hallows' in this class.
question_text:
Which of the following are part of the 'Depthly Hallows' as defined in this class? (select all that apply)

Parallax  
Perspective Lines
